intro: Aylostera azurduyensis, commonly known as the Azurduy's aylostera, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Aylostera azurduyensis is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
